channel.title: Snake
channel.description:
A few days ago, I started creating this simple little game, and after a few hours, I realized the design was all wrong, so I had to remake it.
This is Snake I not Snake II, meaning if you touch a wall you will die.
Here is the applet, in case you want to test it out: www.abraham2119.net63.net/snake.html
Source is attached.
Feedback is appreciated.

item.title: Snake
item.dc:creator: @xeez xeez`
item.description:

ownagesbot, I am not abraham…

item.title: Snake
item.dc:creator: @ownagesbot ownagesbot
item.description:
@ownagesbot wrote:

[quote=“xeez`, post:21, topic:268286”][quote author=Gnarly… link=topic=354086.msg2913540#msg2913540 date=1250263661]
I got to 78 but sometimes it creates an apple inside your snake. ^.^
[/quote]Yes, this happens to me as well. It appears within my snake, disappears, and then appears outside of the snake. I assume this is because he includes the snake within the valid boundaries of the apple.

@OP: This is an easy fix. It would be even easier if you would assign a grid to the game, as nueb35 said. This would also fix the problem of the apple disappearing even though it appears as if the apple were never touched (even though it was).

Other than that, it’s pretty good.[/quote]Abraham you sound like a dick talking to yourself.

Read full topic

item.title: Snake
item.dc:creator: @xeez xeez`
item.description:
@xeez wrote:

[quote=“Gnarly…, post:20, topic:268286”]I got to 78 but sometimes it creates an apple inside your snake. ^.^[/quote]Yes, this happens to me as well. It appears within my snake, disappears, and then appears outside of the snake. I assume this is because he includes the snake within the valid boundaries of the apple.

@OP: This is an easy fix. It would be even easier if you would assign a grid to the game, as nueb35 said. This would also fix the problem of the apple disappearing even though it appears as if the apple were never touched (even though it was).

Other than that, it’s pretty good.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

Very addicting. Got to 63 >.>. I did notice a small glitch though. Occasionally it will create 5 or 6 red balls on the screen which will stay that for about a second or two before all but one disappear. Nothing major though.

item.title: Snake
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I get this:

[code]Java Plug-in 1.6.0_10
Using JRE version 1.6.0_10 Java HotSpot™ Client VM

load: class SFrame not found.
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: SFrame
at sun.applet.AppletClassLoader.findClass(AppletClassLoader.java:194)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:307)
at sun.applet.AppletClassLoader.loadClass(AppletClassLoader.java:127)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:252)
at sun.applet.AppletClassLoader.loadCode(AppletClassLoader.java:640)
at sun.applet.AppletPanel.createApplet(AppletPanel.java:785)
at sun.plugin.AppletViewer.createApplet(AppletViewer.java:2302)
at sun.applet.AppletPanel.runLoader(AppletPanel.java:714)
at sun.applet.AppletPanel.run(AppletPanel.java:368)
at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:619)
[/code]

Strange.

Read full topic

item.title: Snake
item.dc:creator: @abrhm2119 abrhm2119
item.description:
@abrhm2119 wrote:

@greg, the only glitch i have seen is that you can sort of ‘climb’ on the bottom wall; and the only reason for that is because the bottom border i added is not really ‘in-touch’ with the actual boundaries i put to the snake. it is an easy fix; i just cbf to reupload it.

any other bugs?

Read full topic

item.title: Snake
item.dc:creator: @abrhm2119 abrhm2119
item.description:
@abrhm2119 wrote:

[quote=“io9, post:4, topic:268286”]I could’ve sworn I’ve seen this somewhere else ages ago.[/quote]proof or gtfo…i made this…

@unhandled: im sure you clicked the applet before pressing enter…other than that, i dont know why it wont work.

i only use keyPressed() for receiving keyevents. the whole program should be cross platform, if you want, revise the source and tell me; i dont have much experience with bsd.

EDIT: i had someone test it on linux and it worked.

Read full topic
